overview: Helen Keller (June 27, 1880-June 1, 1968) was an American author, activist, and lecturer. Born in Alabama to Captain Arthur H. Keller, a former officer of the Confederate Army and Kate Adams Keller, second cousin of Robert E. Lee, Helen came down with an illness that left her deaf and blind at the age of only nineteen months.
tagline: Teach generosity, discipline, and triumph with this 30-minute animated educational DVD about Helen Keller and her teacher, Anne Sullivan.
title: Animated Hero Classics: Helen Keller
